pieces

Class ChessPiece

  • java.lang.Object
    • pieces.ChessPiece
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Bishop, blackspace, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook, whitespace

    public class ChessPiece
extends java.lang.Object
    Super class for each chess piece
    Author:
    Veton Abazovic

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      boolean en_passant
      Set to true if moveCount == 1 and it moves two spaces, stays true for one turn
      int moveCount
      Number of times a piece has moved during the game
      java.lang.String player
      Player (White/Black) attached to the chess piece, empty if a whitespace or blackspace

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ChessPiece(java.lang.String player)
      Initializes a new ChessPiece with player equal to Black, White, or "" if piece is a whitespace or blackspace

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getPieceName()
      This returns the simple class name of the piece, such as "King","Rook","whitespace", etc.
      boolean isMoveValid(java.lang.String player, Coords start, Coords end, java.lang.String endSpot, Board game)
      This function uses logic against each piece and it's movement to determine if the path from start to end is a valid move for the piece.
      java.lang.String toString()
      This returns the formal piece game code (ex: "bk" for Black King).

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • player

        public java.lang.String player
        Player (White/Black) attached to the chess piece, empty if a whitespace or blackspace

      • moveCount

        public int moveCount
        Number of times a piece has moved during the game

      • en_passant

        public boolean en_passant
        Set to true if moveCount == 1 and it moves two spaces, stays true for one turn

    • Constructor Detail

      • ChessPiece

        public ChessPiece(java.lang.String player)
        Initializes a new ChessPiece with player equal to Black, White, or "" if piece is a whitespace or blackspace
        Parameters:
        player - "White" or "Black" or ""

    • Method Detail

      • getPieceName

        public java.lang.String getPieceName()
        This returns the simple class name of the piece, such as "King","Rook","whitespace", etc.
        Returns:
        Class name of piece

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        This returns the formal piece game code (ex: "bk" for Black King). It examines the player field of the ChessPiece to determine the color, and uses getPieceName() to complete the piece code.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        Piece game code

      • isMoveValid

        public boolean isMoveValid(java.lang.String player,
                           Coords start,
                           Coords end,
                           java.lang.String endSpot,
                           Board game)
        This function uses logic against each piece and it's movement to determine if the path from start to end is a valid move for the piece. It checks against the current state of the board, to also determine if other pieces cause a conflict, making the move invalid.
        Parameters:
        player - Player name ("White", "Black", or "") at start position of move
        start - Coords object holding the start position of piece
        end - Coords object holding the end position of the move
        endSpot - Player name ("White", "Black", or "") at end position of move
        game - Current game board
        Returns:
        True if the move is valid, false otherwise
